The Government of the Republic of Armenia and the Government of the Syrian Arab Republic (hereinafter referred to as the Contracting Parties)

Having regard to the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and their peoples in order to create favorable conditions for investors of one Contracting Party to make investments in the territory of the other Contracting Party, on the basis of sovereign equality and mutual benefit, and
Recognizing that an agreement on investment promotion and protection will promote investment in both countries,

div.title: Definitions
div.p: 1. For the purposes of this Agreement,

"Investment" term means any kind of assets, which are invested by an investor of one Contracting Party in the territory of the other Contracting Party, its laws and regulations, and in particular, though not exclusively, includes:
a) movable and immovable property and other property rights, such as liens, privileges, guarantees and other similar rights;

b) shares, bonds or other Contracting Party in the territory of any other forms of participation in companies or joint ventures, c) patents, industrial designs, trade marks, trade names, "nou-hau" and other intellectual property rights,
d) investment-related business concessions conferred by law or under contract, including concession for the exploration and exploitation of natural resources;
2. "Investors" term means.
a) natural persons who are nationals of either of the two states in accordance with its laws and regulations;

b) economic, legal persons or other organizations that are established by the Contracting Parties in accordance with the laws and regulations, and whose legal address is in the territory of that Contracting Party;
3. "without delay" is deemed to be fulfilled if the transfer is made in such period as is normally required by international financial practices;
4. "Income" term means the amounts derived from an investment, particularly, but not exclusively, includes profits, interest, dividends, capital gains, royalties and fees;
5. The term means "territory".
In case of Armenia, the Republic of Armenia

The land territory, internal waters and air space above them, over which the Republic of Armenia to exercise sovereign rights and exercises jurisdiction in accordance with its national laws and applicable international law;

"Syria," according to international law, by means of the Syrian Arab Republic territory, including internal waters, marine areas, underwater areas and their upper airspace, over which Syria has sovereign rights, as well as other coastal areas, over which Syria has sovereign the right to exercise the right to natural resources exploration, exploitation and maintenance purposes;

div.title: Investment promotion and protection
div.p: 1. Each Contracting Party shall encourage and create favorable conditions for investments by investors of the other Contracting Party in its territory and shall admit such investments in accordance with its laws and regulations;

2. Each Contracting Party shall at all times fair and equitable treatment to investments of investors, and investors must receive proper protection and security in the territory of the other Contracting Party;

div.title: More favorable provisions
div.p: 1. Investments of investors of either Contracting Party, made in accordance with the laws and regulations in the territory of the other Contracting Party from the territory of the other Contracting Party on terms not less favorable legal protection and fair treatment than the treatment that is accorded to its own investors or similar situation the investors of any third state, if it is more favorable;

2. If a Contracting Party to give special privileges to investors of any third state free trade area, customs union, common market or a creator based on the avoidance of double taxation agreement or other similar agreement with a regional organization, then he is not obliged to provide such benefits to investors of the other Contracting Party;

div.title: Alienation
div.p: 1. The contributions of each of the investors of the other Contracting Party shall not be alienated, sepakanazrkven, nationalized or subjected to alienation, sepakanazrkmane nationalization and other measures of equivalent effect (hereinafter referred to as expropriation); Contributions may be alienated for the needs of society and the state only in exceptional cases where the public interest prevail, as prescribed by law, on the basis of non-discrimination and adequate compensation, to be paid in disposing of taking measures in accordance with the Constitution and laws of the host country; This compensation shall be equivalent to the fair market value of the expropriated investment immediately before the alienation or alienation became publicly known, should include imminent interest, calculated at the commercial rate of interest applicable from the date of acquisition until the date of payment and shall be effectively realizable;
2. In the event of expropriation and compensation will be no less favorable treatment than that attitude, which demonstrates its Contracting Party or any third State
Investors; Compensation shall be made in freely convertible currency;

3. A Contracting Party to the investors to which the acquisition was made, have a quick review of their case by a judicial or other independent authority of the other Contracting Party the right investment evaluation, in accordance with the principles set out in this article;

4. When a Contracting Party expropriates the assets of a company which is incorporated or constituted under its laws and regulations and in which investors of the other Contracting Party owns other shares, bonds or a form of participation, the provisions of this Article;

div.title: Compensation for losses
div.p: 1. Investors of one Contracting Party whose investments in the territory of the other Contracting Party suffer losses owing to war or other armed conflict, revolution, a state of emergency, revolt, insurrection, rebellion or civil unrest as a result of that Contracting Party in the territory of the Contracting Party to compensation for damages, recovery or associated with other mode of settlement;
2. This regime must not be less favorable than the treatment which the latter Contracting Party to provide its investors or any third State, if the latter is more favorable to the investors;

div.title: Transfers
div.p: 1. Contracting Parties with respect to investments of investors of the other Contracting Party under the laws and regulations of each guarantee without delay to.

div.title: Subrogation
div.p: If the Contracting Parties to contribute to one of the investors covered by non-commercial risks as prescribed by law, the insurer or reinsurer pass through subrogation of the investor's rights under the insurance contract should be recognized in the other Contracting Party, however, provided that the insurer or reinsurer will not receive any other rights which the investor does not have the right to carry out;

div.title: Settlement of disputes between an investor and a contracting party
div.p: 1. Any dispute between an investor of one Contracting Party and the other Contracting Party in connection with an investment in the territory of the other Contracting Party, where possible, be settled amicably, through consultations and negotiations between the parties to the dispute;
2. If the dispute can not be settled through negotiation within a year, then each party has the right to submit a dispute dispute in the competent court of the host Contracting Party contributions;

3. If a dispute concerning the amount of compensation for expropriation can not be settled through negotiation within one year specified in paragraph 1 of this Article, it may, at the request of either party, the dzZh LPA (formed for this purpose) arbitration; of this paragraph,
The provisions do not apply if the investor has applied to the procedure specified in paragraph 2 of this Article;

4. Such an arbitral tribunal shall be constituted for each individual case in the following manner. Each party to the dispute shall appoint one member of the court, and these two members shall elect a president for a third State with which both Contracting Parties have diplomatic relations; The first two members shall be appointed member of one of the parties to the dispute, the dispute in this way within two months of notification to the other side of the handle and the President, within four months; If the Court of Arbitration is not formed, then each party involved in the dispute may invite the Secretary General of the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes, make the necessary appointments;

5. The tribunal shall determine its own procedure; However, the court may follow the procedure for defining the rules of arbitration of the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes, as a guideline;

6. The arbitral tribunal shall reach its decision by majority vote; The decision is final and binding for both parties to the dispute; Both Contracting Parties shall commit themselves to make a decision, in accordance with their respective internal legislation;

7. The arbitral tribunal shall render its parties to the dispute, the input of the laws of the Contracting Party, including the rules on conflict of law, the provisions of this Agreement and the generally recognized principles of international law which the Contracting Parties have accepted;

8. Each party shall bear the costs of the dispute in connection with his representation of her court appointed a member of the judicial process; Appointed Chairman and the remaining costs shall be borne by the parties to the dispute in equal shares;

div.title: Settlement of disputes concerning the interpretation and application of this agreement between the contracting parties
div.p: 1. Any dispute concerning the interpretation or application of this Agreement shall be resolved as far as possible
Ongoing consultations through diplomatic channels;
2. If the dispute can not be settled within six months, it may, at the request of any party, be submitted to arbitration dzZh hosh;

3. Such an arbitral tribunal shall consist of three members; Each Contracting Party shall appoint one member of the tribunal, either Contracting Party, within two months of receiving notice of the settlement of the other Contracting Party; During the next two months, two members chosen jointly by the third member of the third State which has diplomatic relations with both Contracting Parties; The Contracting Parties shall appoint the third member of the tribunal;

4. If the arbitral tribunal has not been constituted within four months of receipt of the written notice of arbitration, each Contracting Party shall, in the absence of any other agreement, may invite the President of the International Court of Justice to appoint the court has not appointed the member (s); If the President is a citizen of either Contracting Party or otherwise prevented from discharging this function, the necessary appointment (s) to be invited to the next senior member of the International Court of Justice who is not a citizen of either Contracting Party;

5. The tribunal shall determine its own procedure; The arbitral tribunal shall take its decision in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement and the principles of international law recognized by both Contracting Parties;

6. The arbitral tribunal shall reach its decision by majority vote, and be final and binding on both Contracting Parties of such a decision; ^ J LPA Arbitral Tribunal, upon the request of either Contracting Party shall state the reasons for its decision;

7. Each Contracting Party shall bear the cost of its representation in the arbitration process and its appointees; Chairman and the remaining costs of the tribunal shall be borne by the Contracting Parties in equal shares;

div.title: Changes and additions
div.p: Changes and additions may be made to this Agreement after its entry into force, by mutual agreement of the parties; The amendments and additions to be registered in the additional protocol, which entered into force as provided for by Article 11 of this Agreement and is an integral part of this Agreement;

div.title: Entry into force, duration and termination
div.p: 1. This Agreement shall enter into force through diplomatic channels on the completion of national ratification procedures of either Contracting Party three months after the date of receipt of the notice; It is valid for ten years and will continue to remain in force for the next ten years, and so on, as long as none of the Contracting Parties one year before the expiration of the Agreement, the Agreement shall notify in writing the withdrawal;

2. In respect of investments made prior to enactment of the provisions of articles 1-10 of this Agreement, the termination of this Agreement shall remain in force for the next ten years from the date of termination of this Agreement;
